Mission 06

Identifying Parts of Expressions

Mission 06: Identifying Parts of Expressions

[SYSTEM NOTIFICATION] A Tutorial Gate has been detected. Difficulty: E-Rank. Hunter, prepare to dissect the Anatomy of Expressions.

The Challenge Awaits

Young Hunter, every expression has parts‚Äîjust like a sword has a blade, hilt, and pommel. Today you learn to identify each component by its proper name.

Knowing these names is essential. When experienced Hunters discuss strategies, they use precise terminology. "Add these terms" means something specific. "Multiply the coefficients" is a direct command. Master this vocabulary!

‚öîÔ∏è Hunter's Arsenal (Gear Checklist)

Gather these exact items before entering the Gate: - Toys (for your pretend store) - Play money - Papers to write prices on

üéØ Mission Objectives

Upon completion of this Gate, you will have unlocked: - Mathematical Vocabulary - Name parts using proper terms: sum, term, product, factor, quotient, coefficient (6.EE.2b) - Expression Analysis - View expressions in multiple ways (8 + 7 as both an addition and as 15) (6.EE.2b)

üìñ The Hunter's Knowledge (Brain Download)

The Vocabulary of Expressions

TERM - Parts of an expression separated by + or - signs:

In 5x + 3y - 2:
‚Ä¢ 5x is a term
‚Ä¢ 3y is a term
‚Ä¢ 2 is a term
There are 3 terms total.

COEFFICIENT - The number multiplied by a variable:

In 5x:
‚Ä¢ 5 is the coefficient
‚Ä¢ x is the variable

In 3y + 7:
‚Ä¢ 3 is the coefficient of y
‚Ä¢ 7 is a constant (no variable attached)

FACTOR - Numbers you multiply together:

In 6 √ó 4 = 24:
‚Ä¢ 6 is a factor
‚Ä¢ 4 is a factor
‚Ä¢ 24 is the product

Operation Results

Operation Answer Name
Addition SUM
Subtraction DIFFERENCE
Multiplication PRODUCT
Division QUOTIENT

Examples:

8 + 5 = 13     ‚Üí 13 is the SUM
10 - 3 = 7    ‚Üí 7 is the DIFFERENCE
4 √ó 6 = 24    ‚Üí 24 is the PRODUCT
72 √∑ 9 = 8    ‚Üí 8 is the QUOTIENT

Video Lessons: - Identifying Parts of Algebraic Expressions - Expressions | CK-12 Foundation

üó°Ô∏è The Quest (Activity)

üìú Verbatim Instructions:

Today we are going to make a pretend store. Have them make a store with their favorite toys. The different age groups will need to have appropriate prices for their age group. Set up the store in advance.

Go to your store and figure out the following: - The sum (the answer when you add them) if you buy two of the objects. - The difference (the answer when you subtract) between how much money you have and how much you will need if you buy those two items. - The product (the answer when you multiply) if you buy multiples of one item. - Find the quotient (the answer when you divide) to figure out how much each item cost if you spent 72 cents and you bought nine of them? - Write an equation to represent what you did that includes coefficients, factors and terms.

üí° Hunter's Strategy Guide

Phase 1: Set Up Your Store

‚ïë        üè™ THE TOY DUNGEON üè™           ‚ïë
‚ï†‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ï£

‚ïë  üéÆ Action Figure .......... $7.00    ‚ïë
‚ïë  üìö Book ................... $4.00    ‚ïë
‚ïö‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïù

Phase 2: Find the SUM

Buy 2 items: Teddy Bear + Toy Car
$5.00 + $3.00 = $8.00

The SUM is $8.00

Phase 3: Find the DIFFERENCE

You have $10.00
You need $8.00 (from above)

$10.00 - $8.00 = $2.00

The DIFFERENCE is $2.00

Phase 4: Find the PRODUCT

Buy 5 Toy Cars at $3.00 each

5 √ó $3.00 = $15.00

The PRODUCT is $15.00

Phase 5: Find the QUOTIENT

You spent 72 cents on 9 items
How much did each cost?

72 √∑ 9 = 8 cents each

The QUOTIENT is 8

Phase 6: Write Your Equation

Example: 5c + t = total

Where:
‚Ä¢ 5 is the coefficient
‚Ä¢ c is the variable (car price)
‚Ä¢ t is a term (teddy bear price)
‚Ä¢ "5c" and "t" are both terms

Claude Code Training

[TRAINING PROTOCOL ACTIVATED]
Before attempting the assignment, you must train with your AI companion. Claude will guide you through the concepts and verify your understanding.

Step 1: Open Your Terminal

Open a terminal on your computer and run this command to start Claude Code:

claude --dangerously-skip-permissions

Step 2: Summon Your Guide

Copy and paste this prompt to begin your training:

Hey Claude, I'm Hunter Hyro on Mission 06 about naming parts of expressions.
I need to master math vocabulary: term, coefficient, factor, sum, product, quotient.

Be my training guide and:
1. Explain what each term means with clear examples
2. Show me how to identify parts in expressions like 5x + 3y - 7
3. Give me 3 practice problems identifying terms, coefficients, and factors
4. Quiz me by having me label ALL parts of a complex expression
5. Have me explain term, coefficient, and factor using my own examples

Only tell me "Quest Unlocked" when I truly understand. Don't let me skip ahead!
Start by explaining what a "term" is in an expression.

Step 3: Complete Your Training

Work through all phases with Claude:

  • Phase 1: Learn the concept (Claude explains)
  • Phase 2: Answer checkpoint questions
  • Phase 3: Complete 3 skill trials
  • Phase 4: Pass the Boss Challenge
  • Phase 5: Teach the concept back to Claude

You cannot proceed until Claude says "Quest Unlocked"!

üì§ Proof of Completion

Submit your evidence: - Video of you doing the activity, OR - Picture/scan of your written work

The System awaits your proof, Hunter.

Hunter's Wisdom: Think of TERMS like members of your party‚Äîthey're the separate pieces joined by + or - signs. The COEFFICIENT is like the quantity: if you have "3 potions," then 3 is the coefficient and "potions" is the variable!
